intro: Dysophylla szemaoensis, commonly known as the Sichuan dysophylla, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
